intro: Niedenzuella peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian starfruit, is a rare and striking plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruits that resemble small, fleshy stars. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange fruits with a textured, waxy surface. Its flowers are typically bright yellow or orange, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Niedenzuella peruviana is considered a rare and endangered species.
